verses.verse: (1 Tim. 4:12; Titus 2:15) Therefore let no one despise him. But send him on his journey (Acts 15:33) in peace, that he may come to me; for I am waiting for him with the brethren.

Now concerning our brother (Acts 18:24; 1 Cor. 1:12; 3:5) Apollos, I strongly urged him to come to you with the brethren, but he was quite unwilling to come at this time; however, he will come when he has a convenient time.
(Final Exhortations) (Matt. 24:42) Watch, (1 Cor. 15:1; Gal. 5:1; Phil. 1:27; 4:1; 1 Thess. 3:8; 2 Thess. 2:15) stand fast in the faith, be brave, ((Ps. 31:24; Eph. 3:16; 6:10; Col. 1:11)) be strong.
((1 Pet. 4:8)) Let all that you do be done with love.

I urge you, brethren—you know (1 Cor. 1:16) the household of Stephanas, that it is (Rom. 16:5) the firstfruits of Achaia, and that they have devoted themselves to (2 Cor. 8:4) the ministry of the saints—
(Eph. 5:21; 1 Thess. 5:12; Heb. 13:17) that you also submit to such, and to everyone who works and ((Heb. 6:10)) labors with us.
I am glad about the coming of Stephanas, Fortunatus, and Achaicus, (2 Cor. 11:9; Phil. 2:30) for what was lacking on your part they supplied.
(Col. 4:8) For they refreshed my spirit and yours. Therefore (Phil. 2:29) acknowledge such men.
(Greetings and a Solemn Farewell) The churches of Asia greet you. Aquila and Priscilla greet you heartily in the Lord, (Rom. 16:5) with the church that is in their house.
All the brethren greet you. (Rom. 16:16) Greet one another with a holy kiss.
(Rom. 16:22; Gal. 6:11; Col. 4:18; 2 Thess. 3:17; Philem. 19) The salutation with my own hand—Paul’s.
If anyone (Eph. 6:24) does not love the Lord Jesus Christ, (Gal. 1:8, 9) let him be accursed. (Jude 14, 15) O Lord, come!
(Rom. 16:20) The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
My love be with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen.

(Greeting) Paul, (1 Cor. 1:1; Eph. 1:1; Col. 1:1; 1 Tim. 1:1; 2 Tim. 1:1) an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and (Acts 16:1; 1 Cor. 16:10) Timothy our brother, To the church of God which is at Corinth, (Phil. 1:1; Col. 1:2) with all the saints who are in all Achaia:
(Rom. 1:7) Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
(Comfort in Suffering) (Eph. 1:3; 1 Pet. 1:3) Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and God of all comfort,

who (Is. 51:12; 66:13; 2 Cor. 7:6, 7, 13) comforts us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort those who are in any trouble, with the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God.
For as ((Acts 9:4); 2 Cor. 4:10; Phil. 3:10; Col. 1:24) the sufferings of Christ abound in us, so our consolation also abounds through Christ.

Now if we are afflicted, (2 Cor. 4:15; 12:15; Eph. 3:1, 13; 2 Tim. 2:10) it is for your consolation and salvation, which is effective for enduring the same sufferings which we also suffer. Or if we are comforted, it is for your consolation and salvation.
And our hope for you is steadfast, because we know that ((Rom. 8:17; 2 Tim. 2:12)) as you are partakers of the sufferings, so also you will partake of the consolation.

(Delivered from Suffering) For we do not want you to be ignorant, brethren, of (Acts 19:23; 1 Cor. 15:32; 16:9) our trouble which came to us in Asia: that we were burdened beyond measure, above strength, so that we despaired even of life.
Yes, we had the sentence of death in ourselves, that we should (Jer. 17:5, 7) not trust in ourselves but in God who raises the dead,
((2 Pet. 2:9)) who delivered us from so great a death, and does deliver us; in whom we trust that He will still deliver us,
